noun.description: A cloth canopy which fills with air and allows a person or heavy object attached to it to descend slowly when dropped from an aircraft, or which is released from the rear of an aircraft on landing to act as a brake.

verb.description: Drop or cause to drop from an aircraft by parachute.
examples: airborne units parachuted in to secure the airport
an air operation to parachute relief supplies into Bosnia

verb.description: Appoint or be appointed in an emergency or from outside the existing hierarchy.
examples: an old crony of the CEO was controversially parachuted into the job

origin: Late 18th century: from French para- protection against + chute fall.
